issue.title: to_input_view::iterator cannot be compared to its `const` sentinel

discussion.p:
`to_input_view` was recently added to the working draft by .
Consider: (demo):

In #1, r.begin() returns to_input_view<chunk_view>::iterator<false>, while the latter returns chunk_view::iterator<true>. Since the former can only be compared with chunk_view::iterator<false> that cannot be converted from chunk_view::iterator<true>, the two are incomparable.
This can be fixed by adding the following overload to to_input_view::iterator:

blockquote.pre: template<bool OtherConst = !Const> requires sentinel_for<sentinel_t<maybe-const<OtherConst, V>>, iterator_t<Base>> friend constexpr bool operator==(const iterator& x, const sentinel_t<maybe-const<OtherConst, V>>& y) { return x.current_ == y; }

discussion.p:
Unfortunately, it still doesn't resolve #2, because r.cend() returns basic_const_iterator<chunk_view::iterator<true>>, which cannot be compared to any non-copyable iterators as its operator==(const S& s) requires S to be a sentinel type, which rules out to_input_view::iterator, so the constraint is not satisfied.
I believe we may need to introduce a custom sentinel class for to_input_view.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to the working draft just after application of the Hagenberg motions.

pre.ins: constexpr sentinel(sentinel<!Const> other) requires Const && convertible_to<sentinel_t<V>, sentinel_t<Base>>;

p.ins: -?- Effects: Equivalent to: return x.current_ == y.end_;

pre.ins: template<bool OtherConst> requires sized_sentinel_for<sentinel_t<Base>, iterator_t<maybe-const<OtherConst, V>>> friend constexpr range_difference_t<maybe-const<OtherConst, V>> operator-(const iterator<OtherConst>& x, const sentinel& y);

p.ins: -?- Effects: Equivalent to: return x.current_ - y.end_;

pre.ins: template<bool OtherConst> requires sized_sentinel_for<sentinel_t<Base>, iterator_t<maybe-const<OtherConst, V>>> friend constexpr range_difference_t<maybe-const<OtherConst, V>> operator-(const sentinel& x, const iterator<OtherConst>& y);

p.ins: -?- Effects: Equivalent to: return x.end_ - y.current_;
